headline: Slow Cooker Chicken and Dumplings
description: An easy crockpot chicken and dumplings recipe packed with creamy chicken and soft biscuit dumplings made in a slow cooker for a filling, comforting meal.

video.description: See how to make a simple, satisfying chicken dinner.
video.name: Slow Cooker Chicken and Dumplings

name: Slow Cooker Chicken and Dumplings
recipeIngredient: 2 (10.5 ounce) cans condensed cream of chicken soup
2 cups water, or as needed to cover

recipeInstructions.text: Place chicken, condensed soup, onion, and butter in a slow cooker. Add enough water to cover; stir well. Cover and cook on High for 5 to 6 hours.
About 30 minutes before serving, tear biscuit dough into pieces. Place dough in the slow cooker. Cook until dough is no longer raw in the center.

review.reviewBody: I would add the raw dough a bit earlier, but that‚Äôs based on how you like the texture of your biscuit/dumplings. I would say leave in for an hour. Overall I enjoyed this and will make it again. Would season chicken well before cooking will make all the difference, as well as not using water and using broth or stock.

My changes. Feeds 6 with leftovers. Used one full bag of carrot sticks without cutting them. Add salt and pepper. Used six large chicken breasts. Cut off grizzle, fat, and bone. Cut each breast into three pieces. Cooked on high in the slow cooker for six hours because of extra chicken. Used Progresso chicken stock‚Äî32 ounce size. FREEZING: Take the dumplings out completely. Instead of freezing the dumplings, take a fresh roll of biscuits and put them on top of the soup and remake them. They come out mushy if you freeze them and put them back in.
Delicious!! Used chicken broth instead of water. And seasoned with a little salt and pepper and garlic powder. Shredded chicken before adding biscuit dough 45 mins before serving.
I used chicken broth instead of water. Next time my season the breasts a little with salt, pepper and garlic , but it was pretty good without it.
I cut up a whole chicken so I have dark meat as well. Save the neck, gizzards etc. for later making gravy. I love my dumplings made with Bisquick with parsley. I also add sliced carrots.
Not dumplings. They are processed "biscuits" scones. You really need real suet as well. Sodium very high so cut down processed salty soups. Fine in a hurry.
Easy recipe! Will jeep un rotation!
I have come back to this recipe time and again. Delicious!

Sure it was nice and easy, but something about it made me feel bad about myself. I was off to a good start throwing in some healthy chicken breasts, but then once I felt like I was just adding a bunch of sodium with the Chicken soup and then the biscuits are pure indulgence. My husband stopped eating since it seemed so unhealthy. Mind you, I rarely cook, so to have him not finish his dinner was weird. I finished mine and ate more for lunch the next day, so it was tasty, but just don't expect to get in your skinny jeans or tell your doctor what you just had. Other than that, it was nice to have the house smelling yummy.
Love this easy recipe! Made a few times and I add some carrots and celery to make the broth even more flavorful.

I loved this recipe! It came out DELICIOUS! I did add frozen peas to it and a bit of garlic powder‚Ä¶but other than that I followed the recipe. Very easy and it was nice to just put everything into my slow cooker let it do its thing.
I used better than bullion in water, grands biscuits and more chicken! Well likedüëçüèº

To CDISBROWE: Just use a dutch oven, season meat as suggested. I would brown meat in the butter then follow recipe. Simmer til done (about an hour to 1 1/2 hours) Chicken should reach internal temp of 165 degrees. If using suggestion of fresh veggies put in with soup & broth. If using frozen veggies put in with your biscuits.

My first time making this dish. I‚Äôve always wanted to try chicken and dumplings. Thank you for this recipe. So easy and the taste was great. I made it the day before and let the flavors meld for a day. Great meal for a rainy day.
I added 2 ribs of celery, chopped, and used low sodium chicken broth instead of water. It turned out amazing!

This was delish! Based on other reviews I added celery, used chicken broth instead of water and seasoned with garlic salt, pepper, and a bit of poultry seasoning. Really good and easy on a Monday night!
The only thing I did differently is used Grands Butter Biscuits and chicken broth, instead of water and plain butter. To be honest, it came out really good
Loved it. Very easy to make and filled my family up . Very satisfying meal.
I shredded the chicken before adding the biscuits and added some frozen peas and carrots. I also cut the biscuits into ribbons. Came out so good. (I also used chicken stock instead of water.)
Use cream of chicken with herbs for the soup. That way it's already pretty well seasoned. Also, I like to shred the chicken.

I use 3lbs boneless skinless chicken thighs. 1 family size can of soup, the onion and butter. I fill up the family can of soup with water and use that. Cook for 4 hours on high. Lightly shred chicken in the crockpot, stir in one bag of mixed vegetables, salt and pepper to taste. Add two cans of biscuits and in about 45 minutes, it‚Äôs done!
Simple and easy. .am about to add dumplings to the dish now. ..
So easy. I double the biscuits and add the full 2 cups of water.
Very good! Added lots more spices to make it flavorful. Cut refrigerated biscuits into strip. Removed chicken to shred, then added dough. Didn't take it long to get done.

This is a favorite in my household. Very picky husband and he loves it. I do have to leave out the onions or he'd faint. (He hates onions.) But I secretly sprinkle a bit of onion salt over the chicken before adding the other ingredients. ;-) Don't tell him. I also add a bit of poultry seasoning and use chicken broth instead of water.
Great tasty fall recipe, if you don't have dumplings still great without it!
This worked out well, I used quite a bit of broth instead of water to cover. Kids didn't care for it but I'd make it to give to someone in need.
This is a simple recipe and super easy to throw together. I added some spices and cooked the biscuits longer than suggested and it turned out great.

I am giving this a full five stars exactly as made, with salt and ground black pepper to taste. I have 5 kids, and a couple are very picky eaters. They all LOVED this! It‚Äôs not my favorite slow cooker chicken and dumplings recipe, but it‚Äôs a close 2nd and takes no time at all to put everything in the pot. Oh, I do add more biscuit dough than it calls for; I add enough to cover the entire pot! I plan on adding some rosemary and thyme next time.
For those concerned with canned ingredients, especially cream soups, try Pacific brand organic soups. I have used cr of mushroom and chicken. Much improved flavor and ingredients over the standard.

Good base. Have been making this for years but first time in a crockpot. My recipe: add chopped onions celery to crockpot. 2 lg boneless chicken breast. I fileted them to make 4 breasts. I added 3 chicken thighs,skinned removed. I think the thigh meat n bones add more flavor. Remove bones after it cooks a few hours. Add 22 oz cream chicken soup n about 3 cups chicken broth n one packet Lipton dry chicken soup n noodle mix. Season s,p, Italian seasoning, garlic, tarragon. Cook about 4 hours n shred chicken. Stir in 4T butter. Add baby carrots n corn. Make biscuits using Bisquick biscuit recipe on box. Add small teaspoons to crock pot. Cook abt another 2.5 hours on low. Gently cover dumplings with gravy a few times. I serve with egg noodles (can‚Äôt have enough carbs). Huge hit. Everyone loved it. Will only go crockpot version for now on.
Fantastic recipe! Any leftovers heat up quite nicely too, so we make some and use any remainders for our lunches the next day!
If you add the biscuit material too early they almost dissolve in the yummy goodness.
Loved this recipe! I doubled the recipe, added pepper and used chicken broth in place of water. Delicious!
Came out great. Also I used chicken broth like mentioned.
Delicious
Loved this! Will be making it again!!
Good and tasty
oh what a wonderful comfort food. easy to make and very tasty

This is a great base recipe so I'll give it four stars. You definitely need to add and adjust to fit your tastes. I made the following changes 1. Broth instead of water. Water is pointless. 2. Added vegetables: celery, carrots, chopped green beans 3. Used green onions instead of regular onions and only a small amount 4. Used chicken tenders and seasoned them with garlic salt, parsley, pepper, and oregano 5. Added three tablespoons of white wine Cooking: I can't leave chicken in my slow cooker for as long as recipes say to because it ends up overcooked and dry... I left the tenders in for about two and a half hours (still ended up being a little too long), then removed them and put them in the fridge. I let the vegetables cook for about half an hour longer then added the biscuits. Following the advice of another reviewer, I cut the biscuits in fourths. They ended up being way too soggy. I'll leave them whole next time. Once they cooked, I cut up the tenders and added them back in to warm up. Aside from the weird texture of the soggy biscuits, it turned out well. It could probably use something to thicken the liquid though.
It was a hit! Added crumbled bacon, and dry ranch dressing. Used large can of biscuits and chicken tenderloins.üëçüèº
Loved this! Adjusted amount for 2 and still had a second meal. Let the biscuits in for about 1.5 hours and they actually browned‚Ä¶ who knew! Will make this again‚Ä¶ thank you!
This is so easy and tastes so good! I love chicken and dumplings and this hit the spot.

WOW!! Was suprised at how good this was! I used a mixture of boneless thighs and breasts, but like the thighs better. I used a family size cream of chicken soup and 1 regular can of chicken broth. I add baby carrots at the beginning and I don't add onions (not everyone here likes them). 2 cans of biscuits is definitely too much but 1 can may not be enough, probably 1 1/2. I've tried this with the bisquick dumplings too, but I prefer the biscuits. I add the biscuits about 2 to 2 1/2 hours before it's done.
Beloved around here. I replace water with low sodium chicken stock, add a bag of frozen mixed vegetables, and apply several herbs or spices. It's a fantastic, easily modified recipe.

Perfect! Except change chicken to filet mignon, cream of chicken to tomato sauce, sub cottage cheese for butter, then cover with vinegar! This!? Is what you folks sound like. It's perfect the way they wrote the recipe üòã

I've come back to this recipe a hundred times over the years; we love it. Yes, I tweak it to our liking, but I do that with every recipe I make, as I suspect most do. With the biscuit dough, I try to remember to put it in earlier than this calls for but one thing I sometimes do to help it along is to pull the "crock" out of the slow cooker base and pop it in the oven under the broiler for several minutes, in case that is helpful for anyone. It can actually brown the dough a little depending on how long you leave it so be aware if that would bother you. It doesn't bother us.
I used chicken thighs instead of breasts, turned out juicy and I used two cans of cream of chicken and one can of water.
I've made this a few times and everybody loves it . The only thing I did different is I used broth instead of water

This recipe saved me! I completely forgot my canned biscuits so i had to make my dumplings from scratch. This recipe appealed to me because of it simplicity. Needless to say, they came out great. I followed the recipe as written and my dumplings came out so tasty! Thank you
Good!
Super easy to prep/make and was very yummy. This may very well be a go too for those cold nights during winter.

This is a good base recipe but bland. I followed the recipe exactly and also found that it something more, maybe vegetables or something else substantial. I am still glad I found it though because I can add stuff to it that fits the health need of my house.
too many onions and biscuits. 1/2 onion and 1 biscuit package. i added a bag of frozen mixed vegetables
It barely lasted 1 night in the house and I picked a great time to make it because it was a snow day

I make this recipe regularly. My husband loves it! Sometimes I add frozen peas and carrots about an hour before it‚Äôs done. I also usually have to add my biscuits an hour before it‚Äôs done or they aren‚Äôt cooked enough.

Delicious! The only change that I made was instead of using regular condensed chicken soup, I used Campbell's chicken soup with herbs. That way I didn't have to worry about whether I was using the right spices in the right amount.
adjusted cooking time for being away at work to low, 8 hours, then turned up to high to cook biscuits. Turned out great!

This is ridiculously easy and delicious. First and foremost, I used b/s chicken thighs because chicken breasts suck. (I estimate 1.5 lbs of thighs = 4 breasts) No onion, broth instead of water, 1 can of biscuits. Added frozen corn and green beans just to do it. Liked that. 

I wondered about cutting the chicken up: before cooking? After? Well, it breaks into pieces all on it's own!

One of my kids loved it. The other didn‚Äôt care for the dumplings. He didn‚Äôt like the that they were mushy. I did add the seasonings that others recommended along with a can of corn and a can of green beans. The flavor was good. This is good for cold winter nights. Next time I‚Äôll probably bake most of the biscuits and throw just a little in the slow cooker. I only used one can of biscuits.

This recipe was fantastic. I will use it again because it is so easy. I did reduce the amount of biscuit dough from 2 cans to one and only used half the onion. Love a 10 minute prep for a filling tasty meal!
I figured it would be better with all the positive comments, but pretty bland to me. Maybe Good if you spice it up
Delicious!!!
love it thanks
Good start, I set the temp to low for 7 hours, used organic chicken broth instead of water, added frozen peas and carrots and finally used frozen dumplings at thirty minutes before serving.

This was so easy and delicious that it will become a staple in our house.
Next time, however, I will add a 3rd can of cream of chicken soup so there's more gravy to coat the biscuits. Also I'll throw in a few cups of frozen peas and carrots.
This was wonderful.
This is Delicious!!
Easy and budget friendly. I added a seasoning to it and it was tasty!

This recipe clearly doesn't need more reviews but I thought it was worth chiming in anyway. 

I have seen many similar recipes and the criticism of the dumplings is valid. The texture and consistency doesn't work. However, the base of the recipe is just that, a base to be built upon. 

Edits, adds:

Season the chicken with salt and pepper. 

I added fresh celery and carrots. Used a giant sweet yellow onion over red. Red seems an odd choice to me. I also added dried thyme, oregano, even a dash of paprika. I added a lot of black pepper. Taste the sauce. It will tell you what to lean into. God help me, I added some salt. 

I stole the idea of baking in a pie crust. Knowing that the chicken would end up in a pie, I diced it before throwing it in the slow cooker. The pie crusts were two frozen Pillsbury deep dish crusts. Just before baking, I tossed in a bag of frozen peas. They don't need time in the cooker. Best part? On high, diced, this recipe in the slow cooker only took about 3 hours. Chicken was done, veggies tender.
Easy and delicious. Has a home made taste even with using canned cream of chicken
I agree with others that there is no need to make adjustments. I've made this recipe many times and the only thing extra I put in is a little salt. No need to change greatness!
Chicken was great!!! However, I think biscuit dough made the dumplings too sweet
10 out of 10 will not use again. Very bland.

So simple and delicious as is but I like peas and carrots in mine so I added 1 can of them in without draining, then added enough water to cover. Instead of using biscuits (gives the dumplings a sweet taste we don't care for) I used Bisquick for dumplings the last HOUR of cooking so they would be done. Gr8 basic starter recipe. Silly simple!!
Too dry

I have made it several times and it turned out pretty good each time except once when I forgot to add the water to cover the chicken. This step was missed because I set out all my ingredients per the ingredients list and that is not on it. I add chicken stock instead of water usually and add some veggies such as carrots and corn. Definitely need to add more time for the biscuits to cook. Either split them or pull them apart into little dumplings. I also cut up the chicken. A little black pepper added but definitely do not add salt.
Awesome! The only thing I did different was I used a bag of frozen mixed vegetables and it was great. I will definitely make this again as my whole family loved it as well!

Don't know what happened, but mine turned into a glopping mess of goop. I am a well-seasoned (pun) slow-cooker person, but this one escaped me. It didn't taste too bad, according to my husband, but it just didn't quite make the cut for us.
Very yummy and easy to make.
P.S. As mentioned, this recipe was great, but I found cooking it for 5 hours instead of 6 was plenty of time for tender chicken.
I doubled this recipe, and added a can of cream of mushroom soup because I was short one can of cream of chicken soup. The family loved it!
I've made this a few times for my family and they love it! I did add a whole container of chicken broth and I baked the biscuits before adding them to the crockpot......
This was great! I also made some modifications because I enjoy lots of flavor. You do only need one can of the dough. It‚Äôs more than enough. I added one bag of mixed frozen veggies.
I used broth instead of water to cover the chicken, and it was delicious. Very easy, and my apartment smelt good all day!

I made this the first time as is, and it was a 4 star recipe . 

With a few additions, it's a 5 star! I added some sliced fresh carrots and celery to the pot.
I made some modifications and the flavor was great! However the biscuits did not turn out. Not sure if I was to cook the biscuits with the lid on or off? I cooked it with the lid on....
I have made this several times but I don‚Äôt use the vegetables.my family loves it
Easy and tasty!

I have made this recipe now 4 times and my husband loves it! Like other people have mentioned you do need to cook the the biscuits at least 2-3 hours. I also use chicken broth instead of water. Thank you easy and yummy recipe!

Loved it‚Äî will definitely make it again. The only things I did differently were: I added fresh ground black pepper and parsley flakes at the very beginning. I used chicken broth instead of water. When it was time to shred the chicken, I removed it and thickened the sauce with a little slurry of flour and water, shredded the chicken and then returned it to the pot. Last, I rolled out the biscuits to about 1/8‚Äù thickness and cut them into strips with a pizza cutter. It took about 45 minutes for the dumplings to be completely cooked.
1 can of biscuits and chicken broth instead of water.
Made it as directed. Will try with recommended chicken broth next time
Delicious
I need to try again. Something was not quite right.
Phenomenal.
Loved it

I don't know if it was the size of my slow cooker (it got really full), but I had to transfer the whole mix into a baking dish and cook it in the oven for 20-30 min to actually get the biscuit dough to cook. I also added in some frozen mixed veggies just to suit my tastes and make it a bit more well rounded. But that's just me.
We love this recipe! Super easy and kids love it too.
I loved it, Added chicken stock instead of water added carrots and celery also added a little corn starch to thicken. I think I found my new comfort food. Will make again.
